summary:
Since 1992 Renadi gives workshops on traditional Indonesian music and/or dance in the Tropenmuseum (Amsterdam), at Bureau Kunsteducatie (Amersfoort) and on location.  Among his pupils were classes from diverse conservatoria (Amsterdam, Utrecht, Groningen) and music therapists.

Renadi is also an all-round performer and music composer with years of professional experience. 

He composed and/or arranged music for Wereld Kinder Festival, Tropenmuseum jr., Multifoon, Gong Tirta, Ensemble Radak, Pasar Malam Tong Tong etc.

His talents and experience (1982-2003) with music improvisation is highlighted in his prolific work with Aorta, Kieselguhr and as dancer in AsiaMovesLab 2010.

Music and/or dance performances throughout Europe, and Indonesia.

Collaboration with: Gamelan Widosari, Multifoon, Monica Akihari, Wieteke van Dort, Han Bennink, Pierre Courbois, and lots of others.

"On guitar or bassguitar (also fretless) I'm really open for other styles and projects: folk (guitar), jazz (bass), impro (all and everything), prog rock (guitar, bass) et al."

Specialties: cross-over with gamelan/Indonesian music and/or dance. Renadi's knowledge and experience allow him to utilise classical and traditional forms and transform them into new creations, also co-working with other styles and disciplines. 

His talent for both aural and visual output makes him the ideal partner in multi-disciplinary/media projects.

As story-teller he worked with the Children's Museum, Sinar Bulan and lately Gong Tirta.

treasury_media.title: Corona Lyrics Creations - Open Project
treasury_media.description: Calling all creatives (music, text, pictoral, theatre, dance and others)! I’d like to share with you two lyrics I wrote, concerning Corona times....

treasury_media.title: Ways out of Mind, by Bangkirai X
treasury_media.description: Mostly works in progress and drafts by the one-man prog band that is Bangkirai X.

treasury_media.title: CrossWorX, by Gong Tirta
treasury_media.description:
CrossWorX - the second album by Gong Tirta - Music knows no Boundaries 

CrossWorX is what is says: a body of cross-cultural musicworks, by gamelancrossovergroup GONG TIRTA from Amsterdam (est. 1985). 

A fine mix of music composed by Dutch, Balinese and Javanese composers and an eclectic blend of East/West in terms of styles and instruments, intended to amaze and highlight new and hidden aspects of the once so arcane gamelanmusic.

treasury_media.title: Kampung Pop Unlimited, by Jakarta Street Band
treasury_media.description: Reissue of the only album produced by this shortlived but legendary band which made quite an impact on the quiet krontjong scene with their creative and innovative mixture of keroncong, dangdut, acoustic pop, folk and gave new impetus to otherwise rather sweet, tempo dulu-minded pasar malams throughout the Netherlands. No wonder they ended up in more literate venues such as the Indische Winternachten.

treasury_media.title: Bamboo Songs from Indonesia, by Angklung Santosa
treasury_media.description:
Re-issue of the legendary first and only album (2003) of the unique ensemble Angklung Santosa from the Netherlands. 

The ten songs on this album represent the cultural diversity of Indonesia and can be called true evergreens, beyond any fashion or trend. What makes this album so special is the unique signature of this ensemble, presenting for the first time online their one-of-a kind brand of worldmusic.

treasury_media.title: Kieselguhr - Musical Madness
treasury_media.description: Kieselguhr is something of an ongoing musical search for the power behind the sane and the save side of life. Tapping the madness, the intuitive, the unexpected. Somewhere between 1977 and 2003 things happened which I still cannot pin down exactly. These seven albums give an impression of what can and is hardly be said openly.

treasury_media.title: Aorta - Modern Music ensemble
treasury_media.description:
" ... poetic and crashing"
"impressive with expression..." 
"rich with meaning, relevance and significance..."

Aorta is a duo format together with Mark van Kempen. Impro as a means to go beyond what can be said with composed music. The combination of contemporary musical lingo, intuitive structuring from improvised musics and sounds and instrumentation from (prog/avantgarde) rockmusic. 
These two albums are the culmination of our collective efforts between roughly 1981 - 1998.

treasury_media.title: Album ETE PARFAIT, by Eté Parfait (folk, mediaeval,..)
treasury_media.description:
Duo Eté Parfait evolved from the BaBoum trio, which did the notorious 'Gluren by de Buren' gig in sept 2000 with Marieke Hennie on her self-made bamboo recorders. After years of small-scale gigs as a duo we issued our first CD in 2013.

With new interpretations of well- and lesser known folk-songs, new compositions/adaptations for old mediaeval/renaissance lyrics and original compositions in the same vein.
Dutch, English, Irish, French, Spanish and even a dash of Balinese gamelan!

treasury_media.title: Album RAMBUT PANJANG, by ensemble Kalangkang
treasury_media.description:
Released 04 June 2013 on Bandcamp as downloadpurchase, but you can listen for free on line. Click >> at the right for another of the 11 songs!

A selection of the most beautiful key songs of the Sundanese (West-Java) repertoire, with some Central Javanese and even a Balinese song added. The trio plays original arrangements on ketjapi, suling bonang, violin, kendang, kenong and el. & class. guitar to accompany the vocals.

File under: World, gamelan, Sunda, Folk, zither, Indonesia...

treasury_media.title: Gong Tirta - Een Kikker in het paleis?!
treasury_media.description: Een compilatie van het optreden van Gong Tirta op zondag 19 februari 2012 in het Tropentheater, Amsterdam. Kikker Kodok haalt de gouden bal uit de put die pr...

education.field_of_study: English, Latin, Greek, Math 1, Economy 1, History

projects.title: Music improvisation
projects.description:
Research into the possibilities of improvising as a method/skill to include and exploit mental 'undercurrents', normally not used or developed in performing composed music: free form, instant composing/structuring, stream of consciousness, out of the box mentalizing, dealing with (and incorporating) the unexpected etc. 
Many of the acquired skils have already been of service to me in virtually everything I do. This includes also non-musical projects/activities, like all other arts (graphic design, dance, theatre) and education (workshops, clinics), and even many non-arts activities (management).

profile_positions.description: Dance impro with: Theater Djempol, Gong Tirta, Awàs!, Sinar Bulan, Psychodanza, Indomania 2015.
profile_positions.title: Dancer

profile_positions.description:
Skills on improvisation were honed at Aorta and Kieselguhr and in projects with Boi Akih, Gerard Mosterd, Ubit Iskander, Gong Tirta, Kalangkang, Theater Djempol and various private party-performances etc.

With musicians and/or dancers and story-tellers, and solo.
profile_positions.title: Musician

profile_positions.description:
small repairs on 

Balinese gamelan: 
- changing and adjusting ropes on gangsa, calung, jegog, kendang. 
- simple tuning of bronze keys (gangsa, calung, jegog and similar) and reyong (small melodic gongs).

Sumatran Talempong:
- simple tuning of the small gongkettles.

Javanese gamelan:
- changing and adjusting ropes on gender, slenthem.

Sundanese Cianjuran:
- stringing and tuning the kecapi.

profile_positions.description:
- current works in progress published on Soundcloud. Search for 'renadidotcom'.

Online albums:
- Innocence, Outsider, Hemlock, Decay, Alienation, Escapism and Introspection by Kieselguhr (musician).
- Chromatic Dreams and Cauldron by Aorta (musician).
- Oblivion by Marion von Tilzer, Hans van Eck, Mark van Kempen, Idaner (musician).

- Eté Parfait by duo Eté Parfait (musician, arranger, producer).

Albums by Angklung Santosa, Awàs!, Santoso Sings, and Gong Tirta can be obtained (when in stock) by sending an e-mail to renadisantoso0@gmail.com. The first three can be heard on www.renadi.com.
For Eté Parfait and Kalangkang (Bandcamp) see: https://eteparfait.bandcamp.com/  and  http://kalangkang.bandcamp.com/
Kieselguhr is available as download from http://kieselguhr.bandcamp.com/.
Aorta and Oblivion are free downloadable on https://www.jamendo.com/artist/342970/aorta?language=en.
All other albums: please contact the main artist.
profile_positions.title: CD musician, arranger, composer, producer

profile_positions.description:
Ensemble Kalangkang plays Sundanese (West-Java, Indonesia) music. Instruments: Kecapi (citer), suling (flute), bonang (gong-kettles). Gentle, intricate and subtle music either as concert or background.

Kalangkang is:
Renadi Santoso - kecapi, vocals
Jessica Polak - suling, vocals
Jeroen Sep - bonang, kenong, kendang, guitar

For receptions, dinners, small private parties, restaurants etc. but also theatres and concertvenues.

Kalangkang comes as a trio, duo or even solo.

The first CD entitled 'Rambut Panjang' is out may 2013 and available as download at http://kalangkang.bandcamp.com/
The album highlights Kalangkang's unique and authentic style in a rare choice of the greatest songs from Sunda, Jawa and Bali.
Either purchase individual songs or the entire album - or just play the music on line for free!

Booking and info:
renadisantoso0@gmail.com
profile_positions.title: Musician

company.name: Gong Tirta, Sinar Bulan, Tropical Institute Amsterdam

profile_positions.company: Gong Tirta, Sinar Bulan, Tropical Institute Amsterdam
profile_positions.description:
- Story-telling was heavily involved at my work at the Tropenmuseum Jr./Kindermuseum from 1992 - 2006.

- With dance-group Sinar Bulan from 2010.

- With Gong Tirta in 'Kodok, een Kikker in 't Paleis?!' from 2012.

No formal training, but some serious coaching/direction (from a.o. Mohammad Babazadeh, Saskia Goldchmidt, Dominique Roskott) , and years of practical experience, mostly with children's groups (6 - 12 yrs).
profile_positions.title: Story-teller

profile_positions.description:
Eté Parfait is a duo guitar/flutes/vocals playing folk tunes and new and old compositions in quasi mediaeval/renaissance style. Songs and pieces from the Netherlands, Ireland, France, Spain, Italy etc.

Eté Parfait is:
Jessica Polak - recorders, whistles, vocals, composition
Renadi Santoso - guitars, vocals, arrangements

For receptions, restaurants, private parties etc. but also for theatres.

Sound demo's on: https://eteparfait.bandcamp.com/

Booking, info etc.:
renadisantos0@gmail.com
profile_positions.title: Musician

profile_positions.description:
An unique Gamelan music ensemble performing Balinese music and original compositions. 

A collective of both amators and professionals, they began creating their own distinct brand of worldmusic in 1999 under direction of Renadi, who is artistic director since 1989. 

The first 'official' CD (released in january 2011, following a few 'pirate' albums) is called 'Tales of Two Continents' and reflects the multi-cultural concept of the ensemble. Info on www.renadi.com

Current Live programs:
- Tales of Two Continents (trailer on http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UGosDh7NQss, premiered on 16 january 2011)
- Kodok: a Frog in the Palace?! (6 yrs. and up, trailer on http://youtu.be/9ImwcXy94uY, premiered 19 february 2012)
- 'Tailor-made' music programs for receptions and festivals. Also collaboration with traditional dancers (for instance the famous 'Barong-dance') is an option.


More info on 'Kodok: a Frog in the Palace?!:

A short demotrailer (in Dutch) on Youtube:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9ImwcXy94uY&feature=c4-overview&list=UUuVomF1DEcs6q-Nn9dzpLDA

The complete show (in Dutch):
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LHCqc_sLYZk

photo's:
https://picasaweb.google.com/104424691318037003635/GongTirtaEenKikkerInTPaleis9December2012TropentheaterAmsterdam?authuser=0&feat=directlink


Response from the audience:
"Meant for children, but much to enjoy for grown-ups also. The frog prince, but different! Exquisitely narrated and danced. Who am I, a human or a frog? The gulf between cultures in a nutshell. Recommended!"
"I really enjoyed the dance. Even the fingers and the eyes. Superb!"
"Sparkling and infectious, even the ADHD children in the audience were spellbound."


Booking and info:
renadisantoso0@gmail.com

The gamelan workshop by Renadi Santoso is made available to many highschool groups in the Amersfoort area.

All projects that involve cross-over between Indonesian music/dance/theatre and other styles/genres.
As musician also prog/jazz.

profile_positions.description: Theatre performer at Theater Djempol and Gong Tirta's new piece 'A Frog in the Palace?!'
profile_positions.title: performer

volunteer_experiences.description:
I started as a regular member of the gamelan ensemble of Tirta. When in 1989 the position of artistic director became vacant, I was asked by the board to step in, which I did.
My main task is to continue the weekly rehearsals. It entails much preparationary work, both in short and long term planning. I am responsible for the artistic quality and continuity. Since a few years I also joined the board as director of the foundation Tirta.
As such I also am contact person for Tirta, and it's manager. My main 'management'-goal is to involve all members in the organisational and artistic activities of the foundation. All aspects of music making are important, and should be considered by all members together, not only by the boardmembers (who are also players).
So not only the music itself (both individually and collectively), but also preparing rehearsal-weekends, logistics for performances/public workshops, promotional activities, design/graphics, maintaining and acquiring props/costumes etc., artistic direction, CD productions etc.
Being no professional in management or even trained whatsoever, I'm very lucky to be able in Tirta to develope over the years just these qualities in me, which has proven to be very fruitful in many other engagements with other artists, institutions and other people.
